summary: The COVID-19 pandemic seems to have changed everything, but when it comes to emerging markets, the things that matter the most for investors have remained consistent.

headline: Disney leads companies announcing layoffs; big airline job cuts loom
summary: Companies are cutting jobs as the coronavirus pandemic stretches on.

headline: Airlines are hours away from cutting more than 30,000 jobs without billions more in federal aid
summary: Airline executives at American, United, Southwest and JetBlue have been making last-ditch attempts to persuade lawmakers to provide additional aid as the job cuts loom.
The change means that Facebook users can now message Instagram users without needing to download a new app, and vice versa.
headline: Facebook integrates Messenger with Instagram in first move toward unified chat apps

summary: As New York City restaurants reopen indoor dining at 25% capacity, Union Square Hospitality Group founder and CEO Danny Meyer has partnered with biometric screening company CLEAR to monitor employee health during coronavirus.
headline: Can New York reopen indoor dining safely? Here is what coronavirus, dining experts say
BET founder Robert Johnson says 'I will take the devil I know,' adding he doesn't know what Biden will do
summary: "Where I come out as a businessman, I will take the devil I know over the devil I don't know anytime of the week," BET founder Robert Johnson told CNBC.

headline: Amazon vs. Target: Traders weigh in on the stocks ahead of competing sales events
summary: Amazon and Target are going head to head with their sales events mid-October, and trader Boris Schlossberg said "I think both companies can succeed."
Palantir and Asana were co-founded and financed by billionaires who made fortunes from their early involvement in Facebook.
headline: Facebook's billions are backing two tech direct listings on Wednesday: Palantir and Asana

summary: The Czech Republic, which has become one of Europe’s epicenters for the coronavirus, won’t impose business restrictions that would inflict major damage to the economy, according to Prime Minister Andrej Babis.
headline: Czech Premier Vows to Limit Economic Pain in State of Emergency
Treasury Department could upsize airline loans as Delta, Southwest opt out, freeing up funds
summary: The Treasury Department says it plans to upsize loans to airlines under a $25 billion federal program after major carriers Delta and Southwest decided to stick with the private market.
China's official manufacturing Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) for the month of September came in at 51.5 as compared to 51.0 in August, according to the country's National Bureau of Statistics.
headline: China says manufacturing activity expanded in September
Polaris, Thor Industries boost RV production as 'unprecedented demand' weighs on inventories
summary: With more Americans spending time in the great outdoors amid the coronavirus pandemic, the trend has lead to a glut in inventory at recreational vehicle dealerships.

headline: Apple CEO Tim Cook receives first major stock grant since 2011, could earn more than 1 million shares by 2025
summary: The stock grant suggests that Cook's performance over the past decade is viewed highly by Apple's board, which wants to make sure that he will be paid competitively through 2025 if he continues to be the CEO of Apple.

"We've gained market share in most of our categories, and this isn't just a U.S. phenomena. This is happening around the world. It's going to drive growth for a long time to come," McCormick CEO Lawrence Kurzius told CNBC.
headline: The home cooking trend is 'becoming a habit,' says CEO of spice maker McCormick
Stocks will return to record highs regardless of election outcome, $300M money manager predicts
summary: WealthWise Financial CEO Loreen Gilbert is building her bull case on the economic recovery.

headline: Chiefs-Ravens ESPN Monday night matchup averages 14 million viewers
summary: The game featured the last two NFL Most Valuable Players in quarterbacks Patrick Mahomes and Lamar Jackson and peaked at 16.2 million viewers.

headline: Jim Cramer on Peloton, Wayfair and other stocks with post-pandemic staying power

summary: CNBC.com's MacKenzie Sigalos has the day's top business news headlines. On today's show, CNBC wealth editor Robert Frank breaks down the New York Times' massive review of President Trump's taxes, including the detail that he reportedly only paid $750 in federal taxes in 2016.
headline: Trump's tax bill takes centerstage ahead of big debate with Biden: CNBC After Hours

summary: U.S. stock futures opened flat on Tuesday night after the release of coronavirus treatment data from Regeneron Pharmaceuticals.
headline: Stock futures open flat amid positive virus treatment data, debate looms
Palantir reference price for direct listing comes in at $7.25 a share, NYSE says
summary: Palantir is scheduled to debut on the New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday in a direct listing of its shares.
